intro: Eleocharis bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive appearance, featuring dark brown and light green stripes on its stems. This plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow water bodies. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Eleocharis bicolor is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic ecosystems.
